p.s: In his speech Michel Barnier uses many devices to support his opinion.
In addition his line of argument and his choice of words emphasize his opinion too.
In the following text I am going to analyse the way in which Michel Barnier conveys his criticism of Brexit.
In his first lines Barnier regrets the exit of the UK and he drops a hit about the consequences of this decision (l. 1-3).
In the second part he goes into a closer look what the Brexit means for the UK and EU with a brief mention what the consequences will be (l. 4-10).
In the next three parts he only talks about the consequences of Brexit and about a closer relationship with UK in the financial area (ll. 11-23).
In his last part Barnier highlights the position of EU which is in his eyes very important and will not change after the Brexit (ll. 24-32).
His line of argument has a good structure which stressstresses out EU and the false decision of the UK.
Throughout the use of the pronouns we, our he emphasizes the perspective of the people from which Barnier is a part.
He represents the whole EU and the opinion about the Brexit.
In his opening words he says I deeply regret, as a politican and a citizen ....
With these words he creatcreates a connection with his nation because he shows that he is a normal person too who is not someone with higher meaning (l. 1).
In line two is the sentence we are stronger together which highlighthighlights Barnier's opinion clearly.
He sees the Brexit as a big mistake and wants to keep up their relationship.
In the same part is a metaphor which visualises and appeals to the listenerslisteners' imagination of a decision which brings up a big result (l. 3).
Barniermakemakes a comparison in l. 9 to emphasize again the consequences but for the UK.
There is a use of a rethoricalrhetorical question in ll. 25 with the intention to question why the equivalence system works well for the US industry but not for the UK.
Barnier wants to show with this effective devices that he can notcannot understand the exit.
One very effective device the speaker employs is the enumeration of the good parts of the EU jurisdiction.
The effect of this device is to highlight there is no other jurisdiction which has such a high level (ll. 28-30).
All in all Michel Barnier has given a good speech where his opinion becomes very clear.
He structersstructures it in a logical order which supports his view.
The last part is very strong and gives the finisher.
The stylistic devices he uses, are at the right place.
